# disableScreenUpdatesUntilFlush()

**Instance Method**

Disables the window’s screen updates until the window is flushed.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func disableScreenUpdatesUntilFlush()
```

## Discussion

This method can be invoked to synchronize hardware surface flushes with the window’s flushes. The window immediately disables screen updates using the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSDisableScreenUpdates()] function and reenables screen updates when the window flushes. Sending this message multiple times during a window update cycle has no effect.

To ensure that screen updates are reenabled in a timely manner, it’s crucial that the window is marked as needing display and that the display will occur soon (that is, within the next second). When you invoke `disableScreenUpdatesUntilFlush`, you can make sure that a marked window gets displayed by returning control to the run loop on the main thread or by sending the window [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSWindow/displayIfNeeded()] or [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSWindow/display()]. If it’s unclear whether the window is marked as needing display, you can also ensure that a display occurs by using [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSView/setNeedsDisplay(_:)] for a view that’s visible in the window.

## Updating Windows

- **update()**: Updates the window.
